articles.title: Hong Kong rally seeks voting rights, international support
articles.description: More than a thousand people have attended a rally in Hong Kong to urge people and governments abroad to support the city's pro-democracy movement and oppose China's ruling Communist Party
articles.content:
Speakers also celebrated the results of Saturdays presidential election in Taiwan that saw the Democratic Progressive Partys Tsai Ing-wen voted to a second term in a landslide.

articles.title: Germany: Mass evacuation underway before WWII bomb defusing
articles.description: Thousands of people are evacuating in the western Germany city of Dortmund as experts prepare to defuse as many as four bombs from World War II
articles.content:
BERLIN Thousands of people had to evacuate Sunday in the western Germany city of Dortmund as experts prepared to defuse as many as four bombs from World War II.

articles.title: D.C.-area forecast: Remaining unseasonably warm today; cooler but still mild through midweek
articles.description: We make another run at spring-like warmth today, before turning a bit cooler but still mild into the workweek, with some light showers possible Tuesday.
articles.content:
Todays daily digit
A somewhat subjective rating of the days weather, on a scale of 0 to 10.

articles.title: Tiny Philippine volcano ejects smoke and ash, villagers flee
articles.description: A tiny Philippine volcano has belched steam, ash and small rocks, prompting residents to flee from nearby villages and authorities to raise the danger level
articles.content:
There were no immediate reports of injuries or tourists being stranded in affected villages frequented by foreign and local visitors. Heavy ashfall in outlying areas prompted authorities to advise residents to wear masks.

articles.title: Aramco's 'greenshoe option' pushes IPO to record $29.4B
articles.description: Saudi oil giant Aramco's initial public offering raised $29.4 billion, more than previously announced after the company says it used a so-called "greenshoe option" to sell an additional 450 million shares to meet investor demand
articles.content: The oil and gas company, which is majority owned by the state, began publicly trading on the local Saudi Tadawul exchange on Dec. 11. It hit hit upwards of $10 a share on the second day of trading. This gave Aramco a market capitalization of $2 trillion, maki… [+1087 chars]

articles.title: For New Zealand's Maoris, even touching this sacred tree is taboo. They let scientists climb to help save it.
articles.description: A fast-spreading rot has stirred efforts to protect Tāne Mahuta, a 2,000-year-old kauri tree named after the Maori god of the forest.
articles.content:
He was about to ascend a 148-foot-tall, 2,000-year old kauri tree known as Tne Mahuta, a tree so sacred to the indigenous Maori people that even touching it is taboo.

articles.title: Muslims pray for peace in Islamic congregation in Bangladesh
articles.description: Hundreds of thousands of Muslims have raised their hands and prayed for the welfare of the world as they joined a final prayer in wrapping up a three-day Islamic congregation near Bangladesh's capital
